medical_history.chief_complaint: Left ear pain, fever, and progressive neck swelling.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 3 months prior to presentation. The patient experienced left ear pain, fever, and progressive neck swelling. The duration and intensity of symptoms were not specified, but the neck swelling was noted to be progressive.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was born to an HIV-positive mother who was virologically suppressed on antiretroviral therapy. No other medical or drug history was reported.
medical_history.family_history: The mother confirmed having untreated vaginal ulcers during pregnancy and delivery.
